174.title: Govt spent ₹911 crore on advertisements over last 3 yrs: Thakur
174.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that the Centre had spent ₹911.17 crore on advertisements in newspapers, television channels and web portals in the past three years. Advertisements on newspapers accounted for over ₹690 crore of the total amount, according to Thakur. TV advertisements cost the government nearly 200 crore, Thakur said.

175.title: 'Death pool' that kills anything that swims into it discovered at the bottom of Red Sea
175.article_body: Scientists from University of Miami have discovered a long brine pool at the bottom of Red Sea that's lethal to most creatures. Rare brine pools in Red Sea are extremely salty. They cannot sustain marine life forms because they are devoid of oxygen. The scientists made the discovery at a depth of 1,770 metre using a remotely operated underwater vehicle.

176.title: Air India Dubai-Cochin flight diverted to Mumbai after 'low pressure' in cabin
176.article_body: A Dubai-Cochin Air India flight was diverted to Mumbai after an incident of low pressure was reported in the cabin, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said. The flight landed safely in Mumbai, the DGCA added. "Two senior officers of O/o DAS WR have been assigned the task to carry out a preliminary investigation," the DGCA further stated.

177.title: Droupadi Murmu set to become President of India as she crosses halfway mark
177.article_body: Droupadi Murmu is set to become the 15th President of India after crossing the 50% mark of total valid votes at the end of third round of counting. Hailing from Odisha's Mayurbhanj, she has served as the Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021. She's contesting against Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha. Voting for the post took place on July 18.

178.title: Russia's war on Ukraine making China rethink on Taiwan: CIA chief
178.article_body: China is basing Russian military offensive in Ukraine to determine when and how, and not whether, to invade Taiwan, CIA chief Bill Burns has said. Burns added that China is "unsettled" when looking at Russia-Ukraine war, calling it "strategic failure" for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Notably, China has warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

179.title: Kejriwal ignores LG's advice, says 'will go ahead' with Singapore visit
179.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena, saying he'll "go ahead" and attend World Cities Summit in Singapore. Earlier, Saxena advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit, saying prima facie it's meant for Mayors. "Then the Prime Minister wouldn't be able to go anywhere...[In] most of his visits, he...discusses subjects [outside his jurisdiction]," Kejriwal said.

180.title: Last rites of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid performed in Hisar
180.article_body: The last rites of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during a mining raid in Nuh, were performed with full state honours at his native village in Hisar on Thursday. Deputy Speaker Ranbir Gangwa, Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi and DGP PK Agrawal were present there. He is survived by his wife and two children.

181.title: Parts of ₹14,850-crore Bundelkhand Expressway cave in within 5 days of inauguration
181.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing parts of Bundelkhand Expressway caving in. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had inaugurated the expressway in Uttar Pradesh on July 16. The expressway has been constructed at a cost of ₹14,850 crore. The expressway passes through seven districts of Uttar Pradesh, namely Chitrakoot, Banda, Mahoba, Hamirpur, Jalaun, Auraiya and Etawah.

182.title: Govt’s aim is 'character assassination': Pilot on Sonia's ED questioning
182.article_body: Criticising the Centre over Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the ED, party leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday said that the BJP government's sole aim is to indulge in the "character assassination" of people. "This questioning has been initiated to damage the morale of the leadership, target the Opposition and trample upon the voice of the Opposition," he said.

183.title: No COVID-19 restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram: Maha CM
183.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said all COVID-related restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi and Muharram have been lifted in the state. There are no restrictions on the height of Ganesh's idols, Shinde said. "Our festival should be celebrated without any problems...A single window permission system will be there. All the concession will be given," he added.

184.title: European Central Bank raises interest rates for first time in 11 years
184.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years. The ECB raised its key interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 0.0%. The ECB said that the increase is necessary to limit the pressure on prices over the next two years. It also increased its main refinancing rate to 0.50%.

185.title: Man stabs, pushes brother off 4th floor over property dispute in B'luru
185.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly killed his younger brother by stabbing him and pushing him from the fourth floor of a building over a property dispute in Bengaluru. According to reports, an argument broke out between the two brothers when the accused proposed the sale of one of two buildings owned by their father to clear loans.

186.title: Demanding patch-up with wife, drunk man climbs mobile tower in Maha
186.article_body: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, climbed atop a 100-foot mobile phone tower in Maharashtra, seeking his wife's return from her parent's place, a police official said on Thursday. The man came down only after an assurance from villagers, fire brigade and police personnel that they would strive to solve the domestic dispute, he added.

187.title: Summit is for Mayors: Delhi LG as he denies CM's plea for Singapore visit
187.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has refused to approve CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal regarding visiting Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. The LG advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit since it is a conference of Mayors and won't be befitting for a CM to attend it, ANI reported. The summit is set to commence on July 31.

188.title: Solar panels costing ₹88 cr to be installed on ORR cycling track in Hyd
188.article_body: Solar panels along the 21-km cycling track on outer ring road (ORR) will be installed by Hyderabad Growth Corridor Limited (HGCL), a wing of Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), at a cost of ₹88.12 crore. "The solar panels...would generate about 7 MV to 9 MV power per year," an official said. The HGCL has reportedly invited tenders for the project.

189.title: Bengaluru records highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years
189.article_body: After recording the wettest June in 10 years, Bengaluru has seen the highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years after recording 82.6 mm of rainfall on July 20, IMD data said. According to the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre, Sampangi Rama Nagar received the highest rainfall of 79.5 mm in 24 hours till 8:30 am on Thursday.

190.title: 2 dozen cars damaged during attack in housing society in Gurugram
190.article_body: Around 15 men damaged over two dozen cars at a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 70A, the police said on Wednesday. The assailants also assaulted the housing society's security guards, the police added. Sources have said that the attack is a result of a personal enmity with a resident of the society.

191.title: Pune RTO commences drive against illegal bike taxi services
191.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office on Monday commenced drive against illegally operating app-based auto rickshaw services and bike taxis. "We are strictly checking the auto-rickshaws and two-wheelers which are running without authorised meters and with the mobile app-based system," RTO official Ajit Shinde said. "Earlier, we had seized more than 250 illegal bikes. The same will be done now," he added.

192.title: If Sonia doesn't call off protests, we won't consider her Indian: Uma
192.article_body: Reacting to protests over Enforcement Directorate's summons to Congress' Sonia Gandhi in National Herald case, BJP's Uma Bharti said it'll be determined if Gandhi's an Indian citizen if she stops the protests. "Otherwise we won't...forget that she's of Italian origin and doesn't respect Indian law," Bharti tweeted. Seventy-five Congress MPs were detained today for protesting over Gandhi's summons.

193.title: HC refuses to entertain PIL seeking clean milk for Delhi citizens
193.article_body: The Delhi HC on Thursday refused to entertain a PIL to "advise" the Lieutenant Governor of Delhi and the Commissioner of city police to ensure a supply of clean and hygienic milk. In the petition, the petitioner said that the "neglected, abandoned and pathetic condition of the cattle" is affecting the health of Delhi citizens.

194.title: Trinamool Congress to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential election
194.article_body: The Trinamool Congress headed by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will abstain from voting in the upcoming Vice Presidential poll, party MP Abhishek Banerjee said on Thursday. He said the party will not support NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was the Governor of West Bengal. The Opposition has fielded Margaret Alva in the election.

195.title: No additional amount to be charged for issuing boarding passes at airport counters
195.article_body: Ministry of Civil Aviation on Thursday said it has come to its notice that airlines are charging additional amount for issuing boarding passes from the passengers seeking check-in at airport counters. "Airlines are advised not to charge any additional amount...as the same cannot be considered within the 'tariff' as provided under Rule 135 of the Aircraft Rules, 1937," it said.

196.title: Female users in India leaving Facebook over privacy fear: Meta study
196.article_body: Female Facebook users in India are leaving the platform over concerns about their safety and privacy, said a study conducted by Facebook-parent Meta which was reviewed by Reuters. "Concerns about content safety and unwanted contact impede women's Facebook use," the study added. Other obstacles faced by Facebook include nudity content, perceived complexity of its app design and literacy barriers.

197.title: Break BJP's prison, bring people's government in 2024: WB CM Mamata
197.article_body: While addressing a rally in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday urged the people to break BJP's prison and elect a people's government in the 2024 elections. "What will the people eat when the BJP is implementing GST on everything, even puffed rice and milk powder. How will the poor survive in this country?" she said.

198.title: OYO marketing chief Rohit Kapoor likely to join Swiggy: Report
198.article_body: Hotel aggregation platform OYO's Global Chief Marketing Officer, Rohit Kapoor, has reportedly quit and will join Swiggy as its first Chief Executive Officer of food delivery business, according to reports. Rohit Kapoor took on his current role in April 2022, after Ankit Gupta was elevated as CEO of Softbank-backed OYO. He will report to Swiggy founder and CEO Sriharsha Majety.

199.title: 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts blocked in 2021-22: Govt
199.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that in 2021-22, the government blocked 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts and 747 URLs engaged in anti-India activities. Government has taken strict measures to stop people from creating propaganda, Thakur said. "The government also issues advisory...to the media to adhere to the laid down Codes," he added.

200.title: Nykaa, Estee Lauder launch beauty incubator with ₹4-crore pool
200.article_body: Beauty and personal care retailer Nykaa has launched an incubator programme, Beauty&You India, in partnership with American beauty brand Estee Lauder with a prize pool of ₹4 crore. The new incubator programme allows beauty companies to showcase their brand and have an opportunity for acquisition. Apart from the prize money, the winners will also get mentorship from industry experts.

201.title: 7 get jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festival in Hyd
201.article_body: A local court on Wednesday sentenced seven persons to undergo jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festivities, Hyderabad Police tweeted. The accused were taking photographs of women visiting the temple on the occasion of the festival and were caught red-handed by the She Teams, police stated. The accused were sentenced to prison ranging from two days to ten days.

202.title: ODI cricket is dying, I think it should be scrapped: Wasim Akram
202.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that ODI cricket is dying, adding that administrators should consider scrapping the 50-over format. Akram added, "It's quite tiring for a player to play one-day cricket. After T20, one-day cricket seems it is going for days. So players are focussing on more shorter format. And longer format obviously [with] Test cricket."

203.title: 2 killed as their vehicle rams into container truck in UP's Basti
203.article_body:
Two people were killed when the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a container truck after it was hit by another truck from behind in Uttar Pradesh's Basti, police said on Thursday.
The deceased have been identified as 45-year-old Manjay Yadav and 35-year-old Raju. The accident affected the movement of traffic on the highway for sometime, police added.

204.title: Droupadi Murmu leads by 812 votes after 2nd round of counting in Presidential poll
204.article_body: BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu is leading by a margin of 812 votes after the second round of counting in the Presidential poll. Murmu has received 1,349 votes so far, valued at 4,83,299, Rajya Sabha Secretary General PC Mody said. Meanwhile, Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha has got 537 votes, valued at 1,89,876, he added.

205.title: 300 units of free electricity in Gujarat if AAP wins: Kejriwal
205.article_body: In the run up to Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal has promised free electricity up to 300 units per month if elected. Speaking at a town hall meeting in Surat, Kejriwal said AAP will waive off pending power bills till December 31, 2021. This will be implemented within three months of being elected, he said.

206.title: Samajwadi Party intimidates Muslims for votes: SBSP chief
206.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Thursday criticised his alliance partner Samajwadi Party over its treatment of Muslims. "The Samajwadi Party (SP) gets votes of Muslims by intimidating them but when the time comes to give the Muslim community their rights, the party turns its back on them," Om Prakash Rajbhar said.

207.title: UK Queen's jewels on show at Buckingham Palace to mark 70-yr reign
207.article_body: Personal jewels of UK's Queen Elizabeth II will be put on display at Buckingham Palace from Friday for Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Tiaras, earrings and necklaces form part of "The Queen’s Accession" exhibition, which marks her seven decades on the throne. Queen Elizabeth II is the second-longest reigning monarch in the world after France's Louis XIV who reigned for 72 years.

208.title: Mahindra shares edited pic of footwear outside UK PM's residence as Sunak enters top 2
208.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited viral picture of footwear outside UK PM's residence, 10 Downing Street. "Brit-Indian humour has gone into overdrive with Shri [Rishi] Sunak in the final shortlist of two [in UK PM race]. Of course the real test lies ahead with the larger mass of party faithful," he wrote.

209.title: Woman gives birth on road in UP after accident, dies minutes later
209.article_body: A woman gave birth to her child on a road minutes before her death because of a road accident in UP, police said on Thursday. The deceased, along with her husband, was travelling on their motorcycle when a truck rammed into the two-wheeler near Bartara village, ASP (city) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said.

210.title: Good job: Moosewala's father after gangsters killed in police encounter
210.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, Balkaur Singh, visited Amritsar hospital to identify the two gangsters who were killed in an encounter with Punjab Police on Wednesday. Gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh were involved in Moosewala's murder. "It's a good job done by Punjab Police and such actions should continue...This is just a start," Balkaur said after identifying their bodies.

211.title: Bengaluru civic body to file FIRs against illegal banners
211.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will lodge an FIR by the end of this week against persons installing illegal banners. Speaking on hundreds of political banners installed recently, BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath said, "We have warned...several times...FIR will be lodged against the violators." As per a High Court order, no banners can be put up in BBMP limits.

212.title: Everything’s fine with Putin: Kremlin rejects rumours on his health
212.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said that "everything is fine" with Russian President Vladimir Putin's health. "Ukrainian information specialists and American and British ones have been throwing out various fakes [rumours] about the state of the President's health," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. A video showing Putin limping as he arrived in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media.

213.title: Control room set up to facilitate Kanwar Yatra in GB Nagar: Police
213.article_body: A special control room has been set up to facilitate movement of Kanwariyas through the Gautam Buddha Nagar district, police officials said on Wednesday. The control centre has been set up at the Chilla border in Noida, they added. Separately, movement of heavy vehicles has also been restricted on the routes used by Kanwariyas, a senior police official said.

214.title: Congress workers burn car near B'luru ED office during protest
214.article_body: Congress workers protesting against Enforcement Directorate (ED) summons to party chief Sonia Gandhi on Thursday burnt a car near the agency's Bengaluru office. Congress workers are protesting across the country against ED questioning Sonia in the National Herald case. She left the ED office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours on Thursday.

215.title: 2 men arrested for stealing bikes & selling them online in Kalyan
215.article_body: Thane Police has arrested two men for motor vehicle theft. The accused, Mohammed Shaikh and Abubakar Shaikh, used to search for bikes on OLX, ask the seller for documents and details and then steal a similar bike. They then created fake documents based on documents taken from the seller, change the stolen bike's number plate and sell it online.

216.title: Woman who accused Rajasthan minister's son of rape moves Delhi HC
216.article_body: A woman who accused Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi's son of raping her multiple times moved Delhi HC on Thursday seeking cancellation of anticipatory bail granted to the man by trial court. The woman in her petition stated that the accused, Rohit, has been threatening her to withdraw her complaint since being out on bail. She filed the complaint in May.

217.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris killed, 3 injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
217.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris died and three were injured in a head-on collision between two scooters on the Delhi-Haridwar highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday night, police said. Due to the impact of the collision, the victims were flung into the air and landed several feet away, an official said. The deceased have been identified as Rahul and Shyam Thakur.

218.title: World 100m champion Kerley out of world 4x100m relay with injury
218.article_body: Newly-crowned 100m champion Fred Kerley has been ruled out of the US team for the 4x100m relay at the World Championships in Oregon with a "slight injury to his quadriceps". Kerley suffered the injury in the 200m semi-finals, finishing sixth in 20.68 seconds. Kerley had said he cramped up in the later stages of the 200m.

219.title: Bihar electrician dies while fixing transformer as someone switches on power
219.article_body: An electrician, who had climbed a transformer to repair a technical glitch, was reportedly burnt alive at a village in Bihar's Nalanda district after someone switched on the power supply. "The technician went on the transformer after he cross-checked with the power supply station," a villager said. "It looks like someone deliberately switched on the power supply," he added.

220.title: Naomi Osaka parts ways with coach Wim Fissette
220.article_body: Former world number one Naomi Osaka has parted ways with her coach Wim Fissette. Osaka won two of her four Grand Slam titles, the US Open in 2020 and the Australian Open in 2021, under Fissette's guidance. "It has been a privilege to coach Naomi since 2019 and see her grow into the champion she has become," said Fissette.

221.title: Azam is Pak's captain cool, should lead us until retirement: Miandad
221.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said Babar Azam is Pakistan's "captain cool", adding that he should lead the national team until he retires from cricket. "[He is] our number one captain...He leads from the front," stated Miandad. "The most important thing is he is performing brilliantly himself," he said. Former India captain MS Dhoni is known as 'captain cool'.

222.title: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife: World Bank
222.article_body: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife in the country, the World Bank and other experts said on Thursday. "Inequality is estimated to have worsened, with those already poor falling into deeper destitution," the World Bank claimed. Myanmar is one of several countries in Asia whose economies are imperilled by soaring prices and weaker currencies, according to a report.

223.title: Aamir hosts Gujarati dinner for 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Russo brothers, pic viral
223.article_body: Aamir Khan hosted a Gujarati dinner for Anthony and Joe Russo, the directors of 'Avengers: Endgame', who are in India for the promotional tour of 'The Gray Man'. They were also joined by the film's actor Dhanush and Aamir's ex-wife Kiran Rao. Aamir reportedly also flew down chefs specialising in Gujarati delicacies for the dinner.

224.title: I will never sing with him: Priyanka Chopra on husband Nick Jonas
224.article_body: Actress-singer Priyanka Chopra said she will "never sing" with husband and singer Nick Jonas. "I don't have the audacity to collaborate with him...Whenever I sing in the car, like when my jam is on...then he'll just look at me like that, I just get quiet," Priyanka had earlier stated. Priyanka and Nick got married in 2018.

225.title: Matter of pride for tribals if she becomes next Prez: Murmu's brother
225.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's brother Tarinisen Tudu on Thursday said that it will be a matter of pride for the tribal community, Odisha and the country if she becomes the next President of India. The counting of votes began on Thursday, with Murmu bagging 540 votes after the first round. Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha managed 208 votes.

226.title: Karti Chidambaram writes to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to review Byju's finances
226.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has written to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to investigate finances of Byju's. Chidambaram stated Byju's violated law by missing the legal deadline to file the Cost Audit Report for FY 2020-21. "Byju's proposes to...acquire Nasdaq-listed company 2U for $2.4 billion, while parallelly firing employees...it becomes pertinent to review [its] finances," he wrote.

227.title: Govt releases pic of 1st stamp of independent India
227.article_body: The government on Thursday released a picture of the first stamp of independent India. "The 1st Stamp of Independent India was issued on November 21, 1947 and was valued at three & a half annas," it tweeted with the picture. The picture was released under 'Moments With Tiranga' campaign.

228.title: Big question mark: Kartik on rumours about his cameo in Ranbir's film
228.article_body: Reacting to the rumours that he will be making a cameo in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, actor Kartik Aaryan has said, "It's a big question mark." The film features actor Ranbir Kapoor and actress Shraddha Kapoor. Speaking about Luv, Kartik said, "He has been my lucky charm. Our journey has been great. I can't say much about the film."

229.title: Autonomous vehicle with detachable steering wheel unveiled by China's Baidu
229.article_body: China's search engine giant Baidu on Thursday unveiled its new autonomous vehicle (AV) with a detachable steering wheel, with plans to put it to use for its robotaxi service in China next year. The new AV won't need human intervention and will have eight lidars and 12 cameras alongside it. The AV's price will also drop to about 2,50,000 yuan.

230.title: Shiv Sena leader backing Uddhav Thackeray attacked in Maha, 2 held
230.article_body: Police on Thursday arrested two people in connection with the attack on a worker of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in Maharashtra, an official said. Harshawardhan Palande, Deputy Chief of the Sena's Kalyan city unit, was attacked by four to five men with sticks and rods on Wednesday, a police official said.

231.title: BJP is blinded by their desire for revenge: Baghel on Sonia's ED questioning
231.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED on Thursday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the BJP is "blinded by their desire for revenge". "This is the same woman who was married to [former] PM Rajiv Gandhi," Baghel added. "Sonia Gandhi has not been well, of late, and yet the BJP is after her," he stated.

232.title: School bus with 21 kids catches fire in Delhi, no casualties; video surfaces
232.article_body: A bus carrying 21 children from the Bal Bharti Public School caught fire in the middle of a road in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday. No one was injured in the incident due to quick action by the driver, police said. A video shows flames engulfing the bus, rising several feet above it. Three cars near the bus were also burnt.

233.title: Former beauty queen arrested for stealing wine worth $1.5 million in Spain
233.article_body: A 28-year-old former beauty queen from Mexico has been arrested for stealing wine from a Spanish restaurant. Priscila Lara Guevara, along with a Romanian-Dutch man, stole 45 vintage bottles worth $1.5 million, The Telegraph said in its report quoting the Spanish media. Guevara and the man were caught this week crossing into Croatia from Montenegro.

234.title: Told Disha 'You need to take yourself more seriously' after Malang: Mohit
234.article_body: Talking about Disha Patani, filmmaker Mohit Suri said, "When I watched the climax of 'Malang' with the audience, I...messaged her...'You need to take yourself more seriously. You're not just a pretty face'." He added very few people take it as a compliment and she understood what he was trying to say. "She should...take herself...seriously as an actor," he concluded.

235.title: Doors of Matoshree open for those who want to return: Aaditya to Shinde camp
235.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that real Shiv Sainiks are still with the party led by Uddhav Thackeray. Referring to MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde-led government, he added that the doors of Matoshree are going to remain open for those who want to return. The ones we trusted and offered ministerial posts, backstabbed us, he further said.

236.title: Wrong to summon 2 members of same family again & again: Cong leader
236.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED in connection with the National Herald case on Thursday, party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said it is wrong to summon two members of the same family over and over again, that too in connection with the same case. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

237.title: It's duragrah not satyagrah: BJP MP Prasad on Congress' protests
237.article_body: Commenting on the protests held by Congress over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED), BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "This is not satyagrah but duragrah against the country, its laws and its agencies." "This is also a duragrah for protecting the family which has pocketed the party's assets worth thousands of crores of rupees," the MP added.

238.title: 26-yr-old man stealing bikes on pretext of trial rides held in Mumbai
238.article_body: A 26-year-old man from Hyderabad, Zubair Irfan Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for stealing multiple luxury bikes from people across the city on the pretext of trial rides. "In May, Sayyed absconded with a Charkop resident's Trump bike," a police official said. Two expensive bikes, which are worth about ₹15 lakh, were also recovered from the accused, police added.

239.title: 42-year-old man arrested for cheating woman of ₹2.30 lakh in Thane
239.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Sagar Raut, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹2.30 lakh after befriending her on Facebook, police said on Wednesday. Gaining the woman's confidence, Raut asked her to invest money in a financial scheme. After taking ₹2.30 lakh, he allegedly assured her that he will pay her ₹20,000 per month as return on investment.

240.title: 3 more die in Assam from Japanese Encephalitis, death toll reaches 35
240.article_body: At least three more persons were killed in Assam in the last 24 hours from Japanese Encephalitis, taking the death toll so far to 35, according to the National Health Mission (NHM), Assam. A total of 24 new cases were reported during the period. As many as 226 cases of Japanese Encephalitis have been detected in July so far.

241.title: TMC will win seats outside WB in 2024 LS polls: Abhishek Banerjee
241.article_body: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Thursday asserted that the party will continue with its expansion plans and will win seats outside West Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He further said that tickets for next year's panchayat elections will be distributed on the basis of "merit and not recommendations". Banerjee was addressing workers at the Martyrs' Day rally.

242.title: BJP will be defeated in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
242.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the BJP will be "swept away from power" at the Centre in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. Terming BJP government as "anti-people", Banerjee said, "BJP will not get a single-party majority, and once that happens, others will unite to form the next government." "They will be defeated," she added.

243.title: 3 Indians carrying pistols held by Pak authorities at Wagah border
243.article_body: Pakistani authorities have arrested three Indians who were returning from Pakistan via the Wagah-Attari border after they were found carrying pistols with them. The persons, who belong to the same family and hail from UP's Shamli district, were detained by Pakistani customs on Wednesday. They were on a visit to Pakistan to attend a family function there, officials said.

244.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
244.article_body: Five people were killed after being struck by lightning in Bihar. CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday expressed condolences over the deaths and announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the family members of each of the deceased. "Stay at home in bad weather," the CM tweeted. The deaths were reported in the districts of Siwan, Samastipur, Gaya, Khagaria and Saran.

245.title: Salaries of top Hollywood stars released; Tom Cruise earns most with $100 million
245.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

246.title: Lightning kills 14 in a day in UP, CM Yogi announces ₹4 lakh assistance
246.article_body: Lightning-related incidents killed 14 persons and injured 16 others on Wednesday in Uttar Pradesh. CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased. As many as four deaths were reported from Banda, two from Fatehpur and one each from Balrampur, Chandauli, Bulandshahr, Raebareli, Amethi, Kaushambi, Sultanpur and Chitrakoot districts.

247.title: The anxiety is beyond comparison: Ranbir Kapoor on becoming a father
247.article_body: Discussing the arrival of his first child following his recent marriage to actress Alia Bhatt, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The nervousness and...anxiety for such a thing doesn't compare to anything." "It's beyond [comparison]," added Ranbir. Recently when asked to share two truths and a lie, Ranbir had mentioned having twins along with taking a long break from acting.

248.title: Ruturaj should make his ODI debut vs WI, open with Dhawan: Jaffer
248.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Ruturaj Gaikwad should make his ODI debut against West Indies. "Ruturaj should open with Shikhar Dhawan. He scored four tons in five innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy and deserves a look in. Also, left-right combo stays," tweeted Jaffer. The 25-year-old has played nine T20Is so far, scoring a total of 135 runs.

249.title: Uddhav not a face for 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Rebel Shiv Sena MP Shewale
249.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray was not a "winnable" face for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and it was imperative for Shiv Sena to tie up with the BJP, said rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale on Thursday. "I told (Sanjay Raut) that we respect Thackeray but we have to be realistic. He cannot be the face for Lok Sabha polls," Shewale added.

250.title: Don't relate to fragile entertainment of Johars, Chopras: Screwvala
250.article_body: Discussing the films he makes, producer Ronnie Screwvala said he likes to tell stories that can make a difference. Screwvala added he doesn't relate to the "fragile entertainment" of the Johars and the Chopras. However, he stated it doesn't mean their entertainment isn't good. "They pack in all the stars...the songs...people want that kind of entertainment too," he concluded.

251.title: 'Revadi' is called 'prasad' when distributed to public for free: Kejriwal
251.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responded to BJP's "revadi culture" remark and said, "When 'revadi' is distributed among public for free, then it's called 'prasad'." "But when [revadi] is given for free to your own friends, ministers, then it is 'paap' (sin)," he added. His statement comes after BJP said that "revadi culture" may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis.

252.title: Cyberabad Police arrest 35-yr-old man for cheating, marrying 13 women
252.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for allegedly cheating and marrying 13 women across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in last four years. The accused, hailing from Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district, used to target rich women who were divorced and looking for alliances, reports said. After marrying them, the accused absconded with their money and valuables, reports added.

253.title: 21-yr-old engineering student found dead in hostel room in B'luru
253.article_body: A 21-year-old engineering student was found dead in her hostel room in Bengaluru's Kengeri area on Wednesday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shivani K, was a native of Bidar. The incident came to light when the warden went to check on Shivani after she missed her exam. Police have registered a case of unnatural death and are investigating.

254.title: Over 1.5 lakh people left Sri Lanka since Jan amid economic crisis
254.article_body: Over 1.5 lakh people have left Sri Lanka since January of this year to pursue job prospects abroad, Sri Lankan foreign employment bureau informed. The top destinations where Sri Lankan expatriates migrated to this year include Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Japan, the bureau said. Sri Lanka is reeling under its worst economic crisis in over seven decades.

255.title: What are the salaries of Hollywood stars as Tom Cruise tops list with $100 million?
255.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

256.title: World's most powerful telescope discovers oldest galaxy ever seen, pic surfaces
256.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, has discovered the oldest galaxy ever seen. The galaxy is known as GLASS-z13 and it existed 13.5 billion years ago. The GLASS-z13 galaxy was spotted in the 'early release' data from the James Webb Space Telescope's main infrared imager, called NIRcam.

257.title: BJP leader shares Maha Cong chief's video with woman, he reacts
257.article_body: BJP leader Chitra Wagh tweeted a video purportedly showing Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole with a woman. "I'm not peeping into anyone's personal life. The video has already gone viral," she told reporters. Calling it a "character assassination" attempt by the BJP, Patole said he has asked his legal team to examine the video and take appropriate action against Wagh.

258.title: If Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious?: Anurag Thakur
258.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that it’s the duty of probe agencies to investigate people involved in corruption. "If the Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious? If they have not indulged in corruption then why this ruckus," Thakur added.

259.title: Military believes it's not a good idea for Pelosi to visit Taiwan: Biden
259.article_body: US President Joe Biden said the military officials believe that it's "not a good idea" for US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to visit Taiwan at this moment. Biden's comments came a day after China's Foreign Ministry said it would take "strong measures" if Pelosi visited Taiwan. The Financial Times had reported that Pelosi would visit the Chinese-claimed island next month.

260.title: Not even 10% nullahs cleaned: BJP on waterlogging in Mumbai
260.article_body: BJP MLA Yogesh Sagar on Wednesday alleged that the waterlogging in Mumbai following heavy rains is due to lack of nullah cleaning. "Despite spending crores of rupees...not even 10% of nullah cleaning has taken place this year before the monsoon," Sagar said. "Strict action should be taken against the contractors and I urge...BMC Commissioner to stop their payments," he added.

261.title: No need for female James Bond: 'No Time to Die' actress Ana De Armas
261.article_body: Actress Ana De Armas, who had featured in the James Bond film 'No Time to Die', has said that there is no need for female James Bond. "There shouldn't be any need to steal someone else's character...to take over," she stated. However, Ana added actresses in the upcoming James Bond films should be given a more substantial part and recognition.

262.title: ED questions Sonia Gandhi for 2 hours, ends session at her request
262.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi left the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours in the National Herald case. The agency ended the question session at her request as she is recovering from COVID-19, officials said. Her questioning was postponed earlier as she was hospitalised after testing positive for the infection.

263.title: Series against India opportunity to beat the best cricketers in world: Powell
263.article_body: West Indies batter Rovman Powell has said the series against India is an opportunity to defeat the "most favoured and fancy team" in cricket. "It provides an opportunity...to stake a claim and make a name against the best cricketers of the world," he added. Powell further said that he wants to test himself against Yuzvendra Chahal in the series.

264.title: ED should've questioned Sonia Gandhi at her residence: Yashwant Sinha
264.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said Enforcement Directorate (ED) should've gone to Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's residence to question her in the National Herald case. He also accused ED of humiliating political leaders. "We condemn this and resolve to continue and intensify our collective fight against...policies of Modi Sarkar," a joint statement by Opposition parties read.

265.title: MP man attacked with sharp weapons for supporting Nupur Sharma
265.article_body: A man was injured after he was attacked by a group of people armed with sharp-edged weapons, in Madhya Pradesh, for allegedly expressing support for suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Wednesday, officials said. Following a complaint, the police filed a case against 13 people for the attack on the man and arrested two of the accused, the police said.

266.title: Delhi court adjourns Sharjeel Imam's interim bail hearing till July 23
266.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday adjourned the interim bail hearing of activist and former JNU scholar Sharjeel Imam till July 23. "Imam did not make any conscious call for violence or incitement to violent activities," his advocate told the court. Imam was allegedly assaulted and called a "terrorist and anti-national" during a security check inside Tihar jail on June 30.

267.title: Sri Lanka made dumb bets on Chinese investments, says CIA chief
267.article_body: CIA chief Bill Burns has said that Sri Lanka's "dumb bets" on Chinese investment are one of the factors for the country's economic crisis. "The Chinese have a lot of weight to throw around and they can make a very appealing case for their investments," Burns claimed. Sri Lanka's example should serve as a warning to other nations, Burns added.

268.title: Sadhu sets himself on fire to protest against illegal mining in Raj
268.article_body: A sadhu set himself on fire on Wednesday to protest against illegal stone mining in Bharatpur, Rajasthan. The sadhu, Vijay Das, was rescued by policemen and was rushed to a hospital. Earlier, another sadhu scaled a mobile tower to protest. Sadhus are protesting against mining in hills of Adi Badri and Kankachal, which are revered by devotees of Lord Krishna.

269.title: Over 500 disabled people cheated via scam in Pune; police seize ₹1 cr
269.article_body: Pune Police have busted a fraudulent investment scheme that cheated 570 people with hearing and speech impairments and have so far seized ₹1 crore from the accused. The six accused, all of whom have been arrested, are also hearing and speech impaired. The accused had reportedly promised the investors of double returns on their money within two months.

270.title: I am not a friend of Rajapaksas: Sri Lanka's new Prez Wickremesinghe
270.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that he's "not a friend of the Rajapaksas" but "a friend of the people". Wickremesinghe added he would give people the change they want. In recent months, the three brothers from the Rajapaksa family, Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, were forced to resign amid mass protests.

271.title: Droupadi Murmu leading with 540 votes in Presidential poll after 1st round of counting
271.article_body: NDA's Droupadi Murmu is leading with 540 votes in Presidential election after the 1st round of counting, PC Mody, Secretary General, Rajya Sabha, said. He added that Opposition's Yashwant Sinha has secured 208 votes with a value of 1,45,600. Results of the Presidential election are expected around 4 pm.

272.title: Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred vs India: WI coach Simmons
272.article_body: West Indies coach Phil Simmons has said their priority is to bat out the entire 50 overs in the ODIs against India. "Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred and hold the team together," stated Simmons. "India are a stronger bowling team but we expect a better batting performance," he added. The first ODI will be played tomorrow.

273.title: Rupee's depreciation against US$ lower than other key currencies: CEA
273.article_body: Indian Rupee's depreciation against the US$ has been lower than that of other major global currencies, said Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. "You look at the Japanese Yen and the British Pound. They all have depreciated much more against the US$," Nageswaran said. "RBI is managing the monetary policy and has announced liberalised rules to attract inflows," he added.

274.title: Maharashtra govt lifts stay on constructing Aarey car shed
274.article_body: The Maharashtra government has lifted the stay on constructing a car shed in Mumbai's Aarey Milk Colony for Metro 3. Former Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had put the stay on assuming office in November 2019. Several environmental groups had opposed the decision to set up the car shed in the wooded Aarey area.

275.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann admitted to hospital after drinking polluted water: Report
275.article_body: Days after he drank a glassful of water directly from Kali Bein, a holy rivulet in Sultanpur Lodhi, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was reportedly admitted to Delhi's Apollo Hospital with stomach ache on Tuesday. A video shows him drinking the water, which contains sewage waste. On Sunday, he visited Sultanpur Lodhi to mark 22nd anniversary of cleaning of Kali Bein.

276.title: Other sides will dance if Suryakumar isn't in lineup for WI ODIs: Styris
276.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said every other team around the world will dance if batter Suryakumar Yadav is not included in India's lineup for the ODIs against West Indies. "He's got...match-winning potential...No pressure situations get to him," added Styris. Suryakumar recently scored 117 off 55 balls in the third T20I against England. He had a strike rate of 212.72.

277.title: I've seen sister Khushi work hard & tirelessly for 'The Archies': Janhvi
277.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her sister Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies'.  "I've seen my sister work tirelessly...work really hard and she's auditioning for this role," she stated. Janhvi added, "She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her and I hope it goes well." The film also features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan.

278.title: Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023: Sports Minister
278.article_body: Sports Minister Govind Gaude informed that Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023. "I am very much happy to announce that...the government of Goa has received an email from Indian Olympics Association in consultation with the Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports that Goa will be the host city for organising 37th National Games,” Gaude said.

279.title: BCCI spends ₹3.5 crore on Team India's chartered flight to West Indies from UK: Reports
279.article_body: The BCCI spent around ₹3.5 crore on booking a chartered flight for India to reach West Indies from United Kingdom, reports said. "The reason a chartered flight was booked for the team was not COVID-19. It's difficult to book so many tickets in a commercial flight," a BCCI source said. "It was a logical option to take," the source added.

280.title: GST imposed on puffed rice, curd, what will people eat?: Mamata in Kolkata
280.article_body: Addressing a rally on TMC's Martyrs' Day in West Bengal's Kolkata, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP for the current rise in GST rates and said, "Now that GST has been imposed on puffed rice as well, so will the people of BJP not eat that now." "GST is levied on sweets, lassi, and curd. What will people eat?" she added.

281.title: So hard-hitting & engaging: Karan Johar on Alia Bhatt's 'Darlings'
281.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Karan Johar praised Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Darlings'. "So fun! So hard-hitting and so engaging! All at once...Congratulations my baby girl Alia, what a brave decision to begin your producer journey with," he captioned the post. Karan praised Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan for giving a "green light" to the project.

282.title: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi resigns
282.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi has handed in his resignation to President Sergio Mattarella, who asked him to remain in office in a caretaker capacity. The President's office did not say whether Mattarella would dissolve parliament or call early elections. Draghi's resignation came after three coalition parties withdrew their support for his government.

283.title: ED should have gone to Sonia Gandhi's house for investigation: Raj CM Gehlot
283.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised the Enforcement Directorate for asking Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi to appear in its Delhi office for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. "The kind of personality and aura she has and since she is more than 70 years old, ED should have gone to her house for investigation," Gehlot said.

284.title: Goa tourism body demands rollback of GST hike on small, medium hotels
284.article_body: The Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) demanded a rollback on hike in GST rate for small and medium hotels, saying it will make them uncompetitive and lead to increase in compliance costs. After the implementation of the new GST rates, hotels with tariffs below ₹1,000 per night will now have to pay 12% GST which was 0% earlier.

285.title: I'm only actor to do 4-5 sex comedies, I'm not ashamed: Riteish Deshmukh
285.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh, who has featured in films like 'Masti', 'Grand Masti', 'Kyaa Kool Hai Hum', has said he is the "only actor" to do "four to five sex comedies". "I'm not ashamed of that...I never thought, what would my son think in the future," he added. He stated he did those films when his father was Maharashtra's Chief Minister.

286.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic to miss US Open after organisers confirm travel policy
286.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic is set to miss the 2022 US Open after the organisers confirmed that they will follow the government's rules on non-citizens being fully vaccinated against coronavirus in order to enter the country. Meanwhile, Djokovic recently made it clear that he would not take the vaccine just to compete in tournaments.

287.title: Microsoft Teams back up for most users after hours-long global outage
287.article_body: Microsoft Teams is back up for most users after an hours-long global outage, the firm said. Over 4,800 reports on issues surfaced in the US and over 18,200 complaints were reported in Japan, as per Downdetector.com. Microsoft had cited a "recent deployment that contained a broken connection to an internal storage service" as the reason behind the outage.

288.title: PM, Shah will have to take many births to understand Gandhi family: Khera
288.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera on Thursday said PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah will have to "take many births to understand what Gandhi family and Congress party are". His statement came ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi's questioning by ED. "We'll not hold back, we're not among those who sit at home in fear," Khera added.

289.title: Asked every 'The...' crew member 'How do the Russos know me?': Dhanush
289.article_body: Discussing his film 'The Gray Man' which has been directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, who have also directed 'Avengers: Endgame', actor Dhanush said, "I was very surprised they knew about me." "Whenever I had a conversation with [anyone from the team]...I'd be like...'How do the Russos know about me?'" added Dhanush. "It went on [and] on," he stated.

290.title: I strongly condemn ED's attitude to humiliate political leaders: Sinha
290.article_body: Ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said he strongly condemns the attitude of ED to "humiliate political leaders". "The officers of ED should've gone to her residence even if they had questions to ask [from] Sonia Gandhi," Sinha tweeted. Congress had announced that it will hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

291.title: US President Biden says 'I have cancer'; White House clarifies
291.article_body: While talking about oil refinery emissions on Wednesday, US President Joe Biden said, "That's why I, and so damn many other people I grew up with, have cancer." Biden's Deputy Press Secretary Andrew Bates pointed to his 2021 health exam which noted his treatment for "several, localised non-melanoma skin cancers", which he had removed before he took office.

292.title: When PM Modi was questioned, did we protest?: Prasad on Congress’ protests
292.article_body: BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad reacted to Congress’ protests ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning on Thursday. “When PM Modi was Gujarat CM, he faced questioning…Did we protest? [PM] Modiji appeared before agencies,” Prasad added. Sonia Gandhi has been summoned by ED in connection with the National Herald case.

293.title: Being taken to unknown place: Tharoor after senior Congress leaders detained amid protest
293.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has released a video statement from Delhi Police Bus after senior Congress leaders, including Sachin Pilot, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, were detained amid protests against ED's summon to Sonia Gandhi. "We are being taken by the police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs and other party colleagues are there," he said.

294.title: Is Sonia a super human being?: Pralhad Joshi on Congress' protest
294.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi reacted to Congress MPs' protest against questioning of Sonia Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate and said, "Everybody is equal before the law or not?" "Is the Congress President a super human being? [Congress] thinks they are above the law", he said in Lok Sabha. The House was adjourned till 11:30 am due to the protest.

295.title: Sachin Pilot, Tharoor detained amid Congress protests over ED's questioning of Sonia
295.article_body: Amid protests by Congress, senior leaders including Sachin Pilot, Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot, Pawan Khera, Harish Rawat and others were detained by police. "We're being taken by police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs are there," Tharoor tweeted. Congress workers are protesting against ED's questioning of Sonia Gandhi in connection with the National Herald case.

296.title: Which countries provide visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to Indians?
296.article_body: India has ranked 87th on the list of world's most powerful passports released by Henley Passport Index. The nations providing visa-free access include Fiji, Qatar, Mauritius, Jamaica, Bhutan, Nepal, Indonesia, Oman, Serbia and El Salvador among others. Countries including Thailand, Sri Lanka, Maldives, Iran, Seychelles, Myanmar, Cambodia and Zimbabwe among others provide visa-on-arrival access.

297.title: Grew up watching SRK's films: Anirudh on composing music for 'Jawan'
297.article_body: Composer-singer Anirudh Ravichander, speaking about composing music for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Jawan', has said that he never had a "specific dream" about making his debut in Bollywood. "I grew up watching Shah Rukh sir's films and I am a big fan...it's going to be a great experience for all of us," he further added.

298.title: Shreyas among first names in India's side if he succeeds vs short balls: Styris
298.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said Shreyas Iyer will be among the first names in India's squad if he can resolve his issues against the short balls. "It's now up to Shreyas to find a way to succeed against that style of bowling," he added. Shreyas was dismissed off short deliveries three times during the multi-format series against England.

299.title: Academic institutions need to discharge duties towards society: CM Yogi
299.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said academic institutions shouldn't just become places for distributing degrees, but should also discharge their responsibilities towards society. During a review meeting held on the implementation of National Education Policy (NEP) in the state, the CM called on universities to promote interdisciplinary research work on local problems which are socially relevant.

300.title: Who is Liz Truss, Rishi Sunak's opponent in UK PM race?
300.article_body: Liz Truss, Indian-origin Rishi Sunak's opponent in UK PM race, is currently serving as UK Foreign Secretary. Truss studied philosophy, politics and economics at Merton College, Oxford. Outside politics, she worked in the energy and telecommunications industry for 10 years as a commercial manager and economics director, and is a qualified management accountant.

301.title: Putin seen limping amid concerns over his health; video surfaces
301.article_body: Amid concerns over his health, a video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin limping as he arrived in Iran has surfaced on social media. Videos from recent interviews and public appearances have also shown him holding onto tables and chairs for support and looking bloated. Several reports have claimed that he is fighting Parkinson's disease, while others said he has cancer.

302.title: Spent more time with Naseeruddin than Javed, never became friends: Shabana
302.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi said she would spend more time with actor Naseeruddin Shah than with her husband and lyricist Javed Akhtar at one point, as they did many films together. "We never became friends...He had great regard for my mother Shaukat Kaifi," added Shabana. Naseeruddin had earlier termed 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' starring Shabana's stepson Farhan Akhtar as "completely fake".

303.title: Mosquito larvae found at several govt offices in Delhi; 76 notices issued
303.article_body: Mosquito larvae were found breeding on the premises of several government offices in Delhi during a drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) to check the spread of dengue and other vector-borne diseases. Seventy-six legal notices have been sent to multiple authorities, civic officials informed on Wednesday. Delhi has reported nearly 160 dengue cases so far this year.

304.title: Ex-Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa granted short-term visit pass: Singapore
304.article_body: Former Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was granted a 14-day short-term visit pass (STVP) as he entered Singapore on a "private visit" on July 14, Singapore's immigration authorities said. Rajapaksa had fled Sri Lanka along with his wife on July 13 amid mass protests over his alleged mismanagement of the country's economy. He resigned as President after arriving in Singapore.

305.title: Congress workers raise slogans ahead of Sonia Gandhi's ED appearance
305.article_body: Congress leaders and workers on Thursday raised slogans in support of party chief Sonia Gandhi ahead of her appearance before Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied Sonia to the ED office due to her mother's ill health, as per reports. Congress had earlier announced that it would hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

306.title: 13 Opposition parties issue statement over Centre's 'political vendetta'
306.article_body: As many as 13 Opposition parties attended a meeting on Thursday, chaired by the Congress, to discuss the Centre's "relentless political vendetta" through misuse of investigative agencies to target political opponents. This comes ahead of Sonia Gandhi's appearance before ED in Delhi in a money laundering case. "We will intensify our fight against the anti-people Modi sarkar," the Opposition said.

307.title: Pune University introduces computerised paper checking system
307.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will be using a computerised method to check the students' answer sheets starting this semester. Accordingly, dedicated computers and automatic machines that check the answer sheets within a few seconds are being set up at the university campus. SPPU is presently conducting semester examinations in traditional, offline mode after a gap of two years.

308.title: Sonia Gandhi appears before ED in National Herald case
308.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office to appear for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied her mother to the office due to the leader's ill health, according to reports. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

309.title: Thane residents to get 50 MLD additional water from August 1
309.article_body: Maharashtra's water resources department has given nod to supply 50 MLD of additional water to the residents of Thane city from August 1. The decision comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde directed the state water resources department to supply additional water to Thane city. The city of Thane is supplied with 485 million millilitres of water per day.

310.title: Manoj Bajpayee refutes reports of playing a police officer in 'Pushpa 2'
310.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has refuted the reports that suggested the actor will be playing a police officer in Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise' sequel. Sharing a news report on Twitter, Manoj wrote, "Kahan kahan se samachar laate hai aap log (From where do you guys get such news?)?" The 2021 film was directed by Sukumar.

311.title: Seen such a wonderful knock after a long time: Akram on Shafique's 160*
311.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan opener Abdullah Shafique's 160* which helped his team record the highest successful run chase in Tests, during the first Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram tweeted, "Take a bow !" "We've seen such a wonderful knock after a long time...[It was] under tremendous pressure...One of the best from a Pakistani I've ever seen," added Akram.

312.title: Kohli made team play without fear, it'll get better with Pant: Arun Lal
312.article_body: Ex-India batter Arun Lal has credited Virat Kohli for "changing Team India's mindset" and making them play "without the fear of losing". "There was a time when winning in Test cricket was considered once you secured a draw," stated Lal. "Virat brought that aggression to the team and it [will] get better if Pant continues [his form]," he added.

313.title: Goa govt firm on introducing app-based taxi services: State minister
313.article_body: The Goa government is firm on introducing app-based taxi services in the state, Goa Transport Minister Mauvin Godinho said. The private taxi operators were opposing the government’s decision every time, Godinho added. "This is a tourist state and this time we can’t allow Goa to get a bad name due to the conduct of these taxi operators," he stated.

314.title: Counting of votes for the Presidential poll 2022 begins
314.article_body: The counting of votes for the 2022 Presidential election began in the Parliament House on Thursday morning. The ballot boxes from all the states have reportedly arrived at the Parliament House and the counting is taking place in room number 63. The voting for the poll took place on Monday where MPs and MLAs across the country cast their votes.

315.title: This pic should teach us humility: Anand Mahindra on photo of Earth taken from Mars
315.article_body: Reacting to a photo of Earth taken from Mars, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "If there's just one thing this photo should teach us...it's humility." The photo, taken by NASA's Curiosity rover, was first shared by the space agency in 2014. NASA had said Earth can be seen "shining brighter than any star in the Martian night sky".

316.title: Gas supply to Europe through biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany resumes
316.article_body: Russian gas has resumed flowing through the biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany. The Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline reopened on Thursday, after being closed for annual maintenance work for 10 days, according to the pipeline operator. Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin warned that supplies sent via the pipeline to Europe could be reduced further and might even stop.

317.title: Inmate attacked over watching television in Delhi's Tihar Jail
317.article_body: An inmate was allegedly attacked by two others in a scuffle over watching television at Tihar jail in Delhi, officials said on Wednesday. The fight reportedly broke out in a barrack where offenders aged between 18-21 years are lodged. According to jail officials, the assailants used a sharp metallic piece taken from the fan to attack their fellow prisoner.

318.title: More optimistic I'll win Croatia Open than Djokovic playing US Open: Coach
318.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic said he is "more optimistic" of winning the Croatia Open than Djokovic being able to compete at the US Open. "A tough and...sad year, it started with a catastrophe in Australia," added Ivanisevic. The United States doesn't permit entry to unvaccinated travellers. "I'm not vaccinated and I'm not planning to get vaccinated," Djokovic had said.

319.title: Mumbai transport firm cheats adhesive brand of ₹11.57 cr, owner booked
319.article_body: Mumbai Police lodged an FIR against a goods transport firm's owner for allegedly cheating adhesive brand, Pidilite Industries Limited of ₹11.57 crore. The firm gave the brand 1,544 fake invoices and received the payment. "A former senior executive of the brand received 50% share in the illegally obtained profit...this ill-gotten money was transferred to his bank accounts," the complainant claimed.

320.title: Tesla sells 75% of its Bitcoin holdings
320.article_body: Tesla, which revealed a major investment in Bitcoin, has now sold off most of its holdings of the cryptocurrency. The electric carmaker said it had offloaded 75% of its Bitcoin, adding that it bought traditional currency with the $936 million from its Bitcoin sales. Tesla's $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin prompted a surge in demand for the currency.

321.title: World's oldest known male panda 'An An' dies aged 35
321.article_body: An An, the world's oldest male giant panda under human care, was euthanised on Thursday at the age of 35, a Hong Kong theme park said. The park said his age was equivalent of 105 years for humans. An An and Jia Jia, the world's oldest female giant panda who died in 2016 at 38, were gifts from Chinese government.

322.title: Mumbai youth says he is from D-gang, demands ₹35 lakh from bakery owner
322.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹35 lakh from his former employer, who is a bakery owner in Mumbai. The accused reportedly planned the crime after learning from YouTube and called the complainant on July 9. He claimed he works for gangster Chhota Shakeel and is a part of the D-gang and demanded money from him.

323.title: I wish to see more of Deepak Hooda, he has shown a lot of promise: Ojha
323.article_body: Former India cricketer Pragyan Ojha has said he's curious to see how Deepak Hooda will perform in the three-match ODI series against West Indies, beginning on Friday. "I wish to see more of Deepak Hooda because he has shown a lot of promise," stated Ojha. Hooda has scored 47*, 104 and 33 runs in his last three international games.

324.title: Goa tourism heavily dependent on UK, Russia: Minister Khaunte
324.article_body: Goa Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte said that the coastal state's tourism depends mostly on Britain and Russia, as well as some parts of Europe and added that the state government is taking all measures to get a good footfall. As per reports, British and Russian tourists pay more than other foreign tourists during their stay in the state.

325.title: Expected high-handedness: Cong’s Jairam ahead of Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning
325.article_body: As Congress has planned to launch a nationwide protest on Thursday as party’s interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said Delhi Police is preventing the media from entering Congress party headquarters. "This high-handedness was only to be expected and reflects the mindset of the [PM] Modi Sarkar," Ramesh tweeted.

326.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe sworn in as Sri Lanka's President
326.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Sri Lanka's new President on Thursday at the Parliament complex before Chief Justice Jayantha Jayasuriya. The 73-year-old on Wednesday won 134 votes in the 225-member Parliament after his predecessor Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and resigned from his post last week. Sri Lanka is facing the worst economic crisis since its independence in 1948.

327.title: Sharad Pawar dissolves all national level departments, cells of NCP
327.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has dissolved all national level departments and cells of the party, NCP national general secretary Praful Patel said. "All the national level departments and cells...excluding Nationalist Women's Congress, Nationalist Youth Congress and Nationalist Students Congress stand dissolved with immediate effect," Patel tweeted. This decision does not apply to Maharashtra, he added.

328.title: Haryana to conduct judicial inquiry into DSP's death by mining mafia
328.article_body: Haryana government will conduct a judicial inquiry into DSP Surender Singh's death by mining mafia in Nuh, state Home Minister Anil Vij said. A probe will also be conducted against all other circumstances of illegal mining in that area, he added. Singh was allegedly killed by the mafia on Tuesday after he reached the spot basis information about illegal mining.

329.title: Use of AI can help judiciary dispose of pending cases: Guj HC Chief Justice
329.article_body: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) and newer technologies can help the judiciary dispose of thousands of pending cases, Aravind Kumar, Gujarat High Court Chief Justice, said. "Consider Motor Vehicle (MV) cases that account for highest in any court…They can be broadly classified into death cases, grievous injuries cases, simple injuries and for insurance claims," he added.

330.title: More than 500 people die in Spain's record 10-day intense heatwave
330.article_body: Over 500 people have died in Spain during a 10-day heatwave, PM Pedro Sanchez said on Wednesday. According to meteorological agency AEMET, the July 9-18 heatwave was one of the most intense ever recorded in Spain. Sanchez urged citizens to exercise extreme caution, noting that the "climate emergency is a reality". Multiple wildfires have also erupted in Spain amid heatwave.

331.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi ahead of Congress' protests over Sonia's ED appearance
331.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued an advisory in view of Congress' protests over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday in the National Herald case. "Kindly avoid Motilal Nehru Marg, Akbar Road, Janpath...Man Singh Road between 9 am and 2 pm," Delhi Traffic Police said. Congress had earlier announced that it will hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

332.title: Indian woman missing since 2019 added to FBI's 'Missing Persons' list
332.article_body: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has added a 28-year-old Indian woman, who has been missing from New Jersey for the last three years, to its list of "Missing Persons" and is asking for assistance from the public on her whereabouts. Mayushi Bhagat was last seen in the evening hours of April 29, 2019, leaving her apartment in Jersey City.

333.title: Restarting concessions for senior citizens on trains not desirable: Govt
333.article_body: Restarting concessions to senior citizens on train tickets “is not desirable”, the government said on Wednesday. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in Lok Sabha said that the cost of granting concessions weighs heavily on the railways. Ahead of the lockdown in 2020, the railways had discontinued upto 50% concession previously allowed to senior citizens.

334.title: Incident of fire reported onboard INS Vikramaditya; no casualties
334.article_body: An incident of fire was reported onboard aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya on Wednesday when it was on a sortie off Karwar in Karnataka, officials said. "The fire was brought under control by the ship's crew using onboard systems. No casualties have been reported," an Indian Navy spokesperson said. An inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the cause of the incident.

335.title: Donald Trump attends ex-wife Ivana Trump's funeral in New York City
335.article_body: The funeral for Ivana Trump, the first wife of ex-US President Donald Trump, was held at St. Vincent Ferrer Church in New York on Wednesday. The former President attended the funeral with his current wife, Melania Trump. Ivana and Donald Trump's children, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, also attended the funeral. The 73-year-old died on July 14.

336.title: Over 15,000 people booked in Hyd for number plate tampering since March
336.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has booked as many as 15,000 people in cases of vehicle number plate tampering since March this year. Most offenders tamper with number plates to evade traffic penalties imposed by police through electronic surveillance, police officials said. Wrong number plates could mislead the law enforcement agencies in detection of any offence, a senior traffic official said.

337.title: Video of woman dancing in Hyderabad metro goes viral; complaint filed
337.article_body: A complaint has been filed against a woman after a video of her dancing on a metro train in Hyderabad for her Instagram Reel went viral online. After many people criticised her on social media, Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited authorities had said that stringent action will be taken against the woman.

338.title: I want to undoubtedly go even bigger and wilder than RRR: Rajamouli
338.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who directed 'RRR' and the 'Baahubali' film franchise, said he "undoubtedly" wants to go even "bigger" and "wilder" than 'RRR'. "There is never enough for me...To the brink, and nothing less," added Rajamouli. Reacting to criticism over alleged jingoism in his films, Rajamouli stated, "I feel they're just being blind...I don't believe in God [or any religion]."

339.title: Oppn wants limelight by staging protests, doesn’t want discussion: BJP leader
339.article_body: As monsoon session of Parliament is underway, BJP’s Sanjay Jaiswal said that the Opposition does not want any discussion in Parliament. “They just want to get the limelight by staging protests,” he added. His statement came as a response to the question, “How do you view the protests and disruption of proceedings that have taken place?” The Indian Express stated.

340.title: Microsoft Teams down for many users across the globe
340.article_body: Microsoft Teams is facing an outage across the globe, the tech giant has confirmed. "We've received reports of users being unable to access Microsoft Teams or leverage any features. We're investigating the issue and further updates can be found in your Service Health Dashboard," Microsoft 365 Status wrote on Twitter.

341.title: WI ODIs are a big opportunity for India's bench players: RP Singh
341.article_body: With several key players being rested for the ODI series against West Indies, ex-India pacer RP Singh has said that the three-match series is a "big opportunity" for Team India's bench players. "Back-to-back good performances can keep you in the team for a long time," stated Singh. "India [are] aiming to have one replacement for each player," he added.

342.title: It was not Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who broke Shiv Sena: Athawale
342.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said it was not Sharad Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who caused a split in Shiv Sena. "Uddhav Thackeray decided to go with Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at the behest of Sanjay Raut," Athawale added. He further said that BJP and Shiv Sena would have formed government in Maharashtra had Shiv Sena and NCP not come together.

343.title: Rahul Dravid expresses importance of home in his life: Piramal Realty
343.article_body: Piramal Realty has unveiled its latest campaign, #TheFutureStartsAtHome, with brand ambassador Rahul Dravid. The campaign aims to highlight the significance of a comfortable home in a family’s flourishment. Through the campaign, the brand has also introduced an offering of 6.75% fixed interest rates on home loans till 2024, to help mitigate the effect of rising interest rates.

344.title: Person who hasn't physically attended classes can't be called an engineer: HC
344.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has said, "A person who hasn't physically attended classes/course and has not undertaken practical training cannot be said to be an engineer." The court said this while setting aside an order of Haryana Police Housing Corporation which promoted an employee to the post of executive engineer who had obtained the degree through distance education mode.

345.title: BJP distributes sweets when child is born at someone else's home: Kamal Nath
345.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath alleged that the BJP "blatantly used police, admin and money" to win in the Madhya Pradesh (MP) municipal elections. Reacting to BJP's celebration after MP municipal poll results, Nath said, "BJP lost seven corporations. If they want to celebrate there is no problem. A child is born at someone else's home and BJP starts distributing sweets."

346.title: India reports 21,566 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,48,881
346.article_body: India has reported 21,566 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 20,557 new cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 1,48,881. The COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,25,870 after 45 persons lost their lives in the last 24 hours.

347.title: Sanjay Dutt's cancer diagnosis came as shock to us: 'Shamshera' director
347.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra opened up about actor Sanjay Dutt's battle with cancer during the film's shoot. "The news that Sanjay sir had been diagnosed with cancer came to all of us like a huge shock. We had no idea about it," he stated. Calling Sanjay a superman, Karan said, "He is an inspiration on the sets for everyone."
