348.title: Kohli, Rohit were forced to play away from their body against Topley: Hogg
348.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were forced to play away from the body when the ball didn't come back in, while batting against England pacer Reece Topley in the recent ODI series. "That was their downfall [against Topley who gets extra bounce]," added Hogg. Topley dismissed Rohit Sharma twice in the three-match ODI series.

349.title: Cases of manhole cover thefts on rise in Mumbai; BMC blames drug addicts
349.article_body: Cases of manhole cover thefts are on a rise in Mumbai this monsoon with police registering over 200 FIRs in the matter. One manhole cover is priced between ₹2,500-₹10,000. According to a BMC official, drug peddlers and drug addicts are more inclined to such thefts. The thieves operate during night and pull the cover using a magnet, the official said.

350.title: Tharoor shares WhatsApp forward on GST on 'Paneer Butter Masala' after hike
350.article_body: As 'Paneer Butter Masala' trended on social media amid controversy over 5% GST on packaged daily use food items, MP Shashi Tharoor shared a WhatsApp forward saying, "This one skewers the folly of the GST as few jokes have!" The Centre has recently imposed 5% GST on daily-use food items, including curd, wheat, pulses, only if they are packed.

351.title: SC allows 27% OBC reservation in Maharashtra local body elections
351.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) in the upcoming local body elections in Maharashtra. "We want elections to be held...we are making it loud and clear to all of you. Let the election process commence," SC told the Maharashtra State Election Commission. The poll process for 367 local bodies has started, SC was informed.

352.title: There might be rivalry between actresses, but it’s good: Raveena Tandon
352.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon said that there might be a rivalry between actresses, however, it's a good and healthy rivalry as it brings out the best in them. "Actresses I've worked with have been friends for so long. It's not necessary for you to get along with everyone," she added while speaking about the rivalry between actresses in the early days.

353.title: Uniting Oppn most crucial thing at the moment: Margaret Alva
353.article_body: Opposition’s Vice President candidate Margaret Alva said she feels that uniting the Opposition is the most crucial thing at the moment. "It’s not a question of winning or losing, it’s a question of responding to a challenge before the nation," she added. "There will be various steps which bring them together, I think this is one of those," Alva stated.

354.title: MCD to levy 'garbage user charges' on more commercial properties
354.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is planning to levy 'garbage user charges' on more number of commercial properties so that its present fee collection of ₹18-₹19 lakh a month increases to about ₹10 crore a month, officials said. The MCD can charge ₹50-₹200 a month as garbage user fee from residential properties depending on their area, according to by-laws.

355.title: 'Revadi culture' may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis: BJP
355.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil warned the public to not get misguided by "revadi culture" of freebies as it could push the state and country into a Sri Lanka-like crisis. Paatil's statement comes after  AAP's national convener Arvind Kejriwal promised free electricity to people if the party is voted to power in Gujarat after this year's Assembly elections.

356.title: Hyderabad Mayor urges GHMC to expedite flood-prevention works
356.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Wednesday inspected several canal works being carried out under the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) in LB Nagar zone. She directed officials of the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) to expedite the flood-prevention works while taking all precautionary measures. Gadwal also observed the newly constructed dams at Saroornagar lake.

357.title: 2 bikes, school van catch fire in  24 hours in Pune
357.article_body: Three incidents of vehicles catching fire have been reported in Pune. In the first incident, a TVS Jupiter bike caught fire on the main road near Bharati Vidyapeeth following a technical snag on Wednesday. Another two-wheeler in transit caught fire at Mukund Nagar on Tuesday. A school van that had developed a technical glitch also caught fire near Sundarban society.

358.title: Was in tears after Dennis Lillee said I won't play for SL: Chaminda Vaas
358.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Chaminda Vaas said he was in "tears" after ex-Australia pacer Dennis Lillee once said that he won't play for his nation. "I [took it as a challenge, going on to represent Sri Lanka] for 15 years," added Vaas. Vaas stated he reminded Lillee about his prediction after playing 60 matches and 100 Tests for Sri Lanka respectively.

359.title: Critic gave half a star to 'Main...', was like 'F**k the reviews': Farah Khan
359.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan recalled a critic's reaction to her directorial debut film 'Main Hoon Na', which starred Shah Rukh Khan. Farah revealed a critic had given her film half a star and the headline read 'Main Hoon Naaaah!'. "It held strongly on Monday...Tuesday (after the first weekend)...I was like 'F**k the reviews. People are loving the film'," she added.

360.title: I'd find every possible way to have both Pant & Karthik in my team: Ponting
360.article_body: Talking about India's possible playing XI for the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he would've tried every possible way to have both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in his T20I side. "Rishabh to bat, in that three-four-five range, and have Dinesh and Hardik Pandya...[as finishers]," stated Ponting. "I don't think Suryakumar will miss out," he added.

361.title: FIR against Ghatkopar builder for forgery and illegal sale of flats
361.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against builder 'Yog Realty' for misleading 45 tenants of Bhaveshwar Housing Society, Ghatkopar, Mumbai as the flats they were supposed to get in the redeveloped towers were illegally sold to other people. The developer allegedly misled even Bombay High Court on allotments of flats to tenants. The tenants alleged a scam of over ₹15 crore.

362.title: Fake courier service busted in Bengaluru, 4 people arrested
362.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Wednesday busted a fake courier service operating in the city and arrested four accused persons. According to DCP (North East) Anoop A Shetty, the accused used to display google ads with their phone numbers as booking contacts of popular courier companies. "Do not blindly believe whatever is displayed on the top of...Google search," Shetty tweeted.

363.title: Libya resumes oil exports after pause since April
363.article_body: Libya on Wednesday resumed its export of oil after a pause since April. The resumption came after Libya restarted production at oil fields following the firing of the Chairman of the state-run National Oil Corporation by one of the country's rival governments. Tribal leaders aligned with one of the governments had shut down the oil facilities in April.

364.title: Govt reviews situation of 9 states showing rise in COVID-19 cases; names released
364.article_body: Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan reviewed the COVID-19 situation of Kerala, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Assam, Andhra Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh. "These states are either reporting a surge in new daily COVID-19 cases or a rise in positivity," the Centre said. They were urged to improve testing, increase surveillance and speed up COVID-19 vaccination.

365.title: NZ's Bracewell becomes 1st cricketer to take hat-trick in his 1st ever over in T20Is
365.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell has become the first cricketer to take hat-trick in his first-ever over in T20I cricket. The 31-year-old off-spinner dismissed Ireland's Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy and Craig Young in consecutive deliveries to achieve the feat. His figures in the match read 0.5-0-5-3. Overall, he's the third New Zealand cricketer to take hat-trick in men's T20I cricket.

366.title: How does the World Test Championship table read after Pakistan's record victory?
366.article_body: After recording the highest successful Test run chase in Galle to defeat Sri Lanka in the first Test, Pakistan now have 58.33% of points won in the World Test Championship (WTC). Pakistan are on the third position on the WTC points table, while Sri Lanka are sixth with 48.15% of points won. India are fourth on the table.

367.title: Man dressed as elderly woman robs bank in US; police release pictures
367.article_body: Police in US' Georgia have released pictures after a man dressed as an elderly woman robbed a bank. "The suspect...presented a note demanding money. The suspect told the teller he had a gun. The suspect is described as a black male, approximately 6 foot tall and slender," police said. Police added that the suspect was wearing a floral dress.

368.title: RTI activist held over extorting ₹2 cr from highway contractor in Pune
368.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 46-year-old Right to Information (RTI) activist for allegedly trying to extort ₹2 crore from a National Highway road contractor. The complainant's company had got a contract for the construction of a road in Ahmednagar district. The accused complained that the work being done by the complainant's company was illegal and allegedly demanded ₹2 crore.

369.title: Russia expanding its war goals in Ukraine: Russian Foreign Minister
369.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Wednesday said that Russia's "special military operation" now went beyond the Donbas region. Lavrov also said that peace talks made no sense at the moment because Western governments were leaning on Ukraine to fight rather than negotiate. In response, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians want blood, not talks."

370.title: 3 held over ₹38 lakh robbery with chilli powder in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar
370.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing two collection agents of ₹38 lakh using chilli powder in Lajpat Nagar's Defence Colony Flyover. The agents were in the area to collect payments from garment traders, police said. They were going back in an auto-rickshaw and the assailants, who were on bikes, threw chilli powder in their eyes, police added.

371.title: 4 arrested in Delhi for extorting money through a Chinese loan app
371.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested four persons for allegedly running an extortion racket with two Chinese nationals through a Chinese loan application. The accused had employed 149 people as tele-callers to extort money from people by using their loan applications and sending them morphed photographs. The accused siphoned off an amount of ₹10 crore to the two Chinese nationals.

372.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹2.6 crore seized in Mumbai; accused arrested
372.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch on Wednesday arrested a man for trying to smuggle ambergris, or 'whale vomit', worth ₹2.6 crore. The police seized 2.8 kg of ambergris from the accused, identified as Vaibhav Janardhan Kalekar. Sale of ambergris is prohibited in India as sperm whales, an endangered species, are protected under the Wildlife Protection Act (WPA) of 1927.

373.title: Five people killed as dumper overturns on an SUV in UP's Raebareli
373.article_body: Two children among five people were killed after a fly ash-filled dumper overturned on an SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli, the police said. They further added that three people were critically injured and are undergoing treatment at a hospital. The bodies of the deceased were taken out with the help of a JCB and sent for post mortem examination.

374.title: 2 men die of electrocution in Shimla, ₹10,000 aid announced
374.article_body: Two men were electrocuted in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla on Wednesday evening, the state disaster management department said. Aman Sharma and Amar Singh were electrocuted while working on an electric pole. The state department said that an instant relief of ₹10,000 each has been given to the family of the two men.

375.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha tests positive for COVID-19
375.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha on Wednesday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fit and fine with no symptoms. I humbly request all those who've come in contact with me to take necessary precautions," the CM wrote in a Facebook post. Earlier in the day, he inaugurated an oxygen plant at IGM Hospital in Agartala.

376.title: NIA arrests 7th accused in Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case
376.article_body: The National Investigation Agency on Wednesday arrested the seventh accused in the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case. Ali Asgar alias Abdullah, a resident of East Champaran district in Bihar, was arrested after the NIA conducted searches in Bihar in connection with the case. Asgar is a radicalized individual involved in propagating jihad by posting incriminating materials online, the NIA said.

377.title: Karnataka CM Bommai assures funds for Cauvery Basin development
377.article_body: The Chief Minister of Karnataka Basavaraj Bommai said that financial grants would be provided for developmental works in the Cauvery Basin. Bommai expressed his happiness at KRS and Kabini dams being filled to the brim this year. Responding to Tamil Nadu CM's statement for an emergency meeting over the Mekedatu project, Bommai said he would issue a statement soon.

378.title: Tanushree claims she's being harassed by Bollywood mafia, says 'I won't die by suicide'
378.article_body: Tanushree Dutta has claimed that she's being "harassed and targeted very badly". She added that she won't die by suicide and she'll resurrect her career. "Bollywood Mafia, the old political circuit of Maharashtra...and nefarious anti-national criminal elements together usually operate like this to trouble people. I'm very sure the #metoo culprits...are behind all this," said Tanushree.

379.title: US-Africa summit to be held in December: Biden
379.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said the United States will host an African nations summit in December to discuss food security and climate change. The US-Africa Leaders Summit will be held from December 13 to 15 and about 50 African leaders are expected to participate. Separately, the US has announced $1.3 billion aid for Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia.

380.title: Jasprit Bumrah loses world number one ODI bowler spot to Trent Boult
380.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for men's ODI bowlers. India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who didn't feature in India's third ODI against England, dropped to the second spot in the rankings. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult replaced him as the world number one ODI bowler. Meanwhile, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal jumped four spots to the 16th position

381.title: Which departments have highest no. of vacancies out of 9.79 lakh vacant posts in Centre?
381.article_body: The Centre informed Lok Sabha that there are around 9.79 lakh vacant posts in various ministries/departments of central government, as per the Annual Report of Pay Research Unit of Department of Expenditure. As per the report, Railways Ministry has the highest vacancies (2.93 lakh), followed by Defence Ministry (Civilian- 2.64 lakh), Home Ministry (1.43 lakh) and Department of Post (90,050).

382.title: BJP workers hold protest after girls told to remove bras at NEET centre
382.article_body: A protest was held on Wednesday outside the NEET exam centre where female students had allegedly been told to take off their bras before taking the exam. Protesters, purportedly belonging to Kerala BJP, were seen carrying BJP flags outside Mar Thoma Institute of Information Technology. Earlier, a student's parent filed a complaint about the removal of innerwear with Kollam SP.

383.title: No forced child labour cases during lockdown: Centre
383.article_body: The Rajya Sabha was informed that there were no cases of children who were forced to leave their homes for illegal child labour during the lockdown reported to child rights body NCPCR. Union Minister Smriti Irani said that 330 railway stations have been equipped with CCTVs and monitoring rooms. NCPCR has received 617 child kidnapping complaints since 2020.

384.title: 2012 batch IAS officer K Srinivas appointed Bengaluru Urban DC
384.article_body: K Srinivas, a 2012 batch IAS officer, has taken charge as Bengaluru Urban district deputy commissioner. The post fell vacant after incumbent J Manjunath was arrested earlier this month for allegedly taking ₹5 lakh bribe. The deputy commissioner's position is quasi-judicial with powers to resolve land disputes and issue no-objection certificates.

385.title: Suspects who set on fire Lankan Prez's home sent to judicial custody
385.article_body: The four suspects who allegedly set ablaze the residence of Sri Lanka's newly-elected President Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo have been sent to judicial custody till July 27. The suspects were arrested on July 10 and will be produced for identification parade on July 27. Wickremesinghe said the July 9 fire had destroyed over 4,000 books and his 125-year-old piano.

386.title: BJP govt in UP invoking NSA even in trivial cases: BSP chief
386.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh was invoking National Security Act (NSA) even in trivial cases, in order to cover up its failure to control crime. "Criminals associated with the ruling party are roaming freely," Mayawati said. "In such a situation, how can rule of law be established in the state?" she added.

387.title: Water purifier firm DrinkPrime raises ₹60 crore in Series A round
387.article_body: Water purifier subscription company DrinkPrime has raised ₹60 crore in its Series A funding round. The round saw participation from Omidyar Network India, Surge Sequoia and 9Unicorns. According to its Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Vijender Reddy Muthyala, the company's goal is to make safe drinking water accessible to the majority of India.

388.title: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande meets Bangladesh PM
388.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande paid a visit to Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina at the latter's residence in Dhaka. The Indian Army chief is on a three-day visit to Bangladesh at the invitation of his counterpart General SM Shafiuddin Ahmed. General Pande is being accompanied by a three-member delegation and his wife Archana Pande.

389.title: Roads melt into sticky, black goo amid record-breaking temperatures in UK, pics surface
389.article_body: Several roads in the UK melted into a sticky, black goo amid record-breaking heatwave in the UK. A local in Manchester said that it looked like cars were "driving through water". "It was that soft your feet got stuck in it if you walked across. The tarmac was all stuck in the treads of my tyres," the local stated.

390.title: Cong showing destructive attitude towards democracy: Union Minister
390.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday criticised Congress for disrupting proceedings in the Parliament. He added that the government is not running away from debate on price rise and such issues can be taken up once Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman recovers from COVID-19. He alleged there was a competition among Opposition parties on who would disrupt Parliament the most.

391.title: Mexican beauty queen, accomplice held for $1.7mn wine theft in Europe
391.article_body: An ex-Mexican beauty pageant contestant and a Romanian-Dutch accomplice have been arrested in Croatia over theft of $1.7 million worth of bottles of wine after nine-month chase across Europe. The accused reportedly stole 45 vintage wine bottles from a hotel in Spain. Spanish authorities worked with counterparts in Netherlands, Croatia and Romania to catch the pair, who haven't been identified.

392.title: 3 men die of electrocution in TN, CM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia
392.article_body: Three men, aged between 40-45 years, died of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district, after coming in contact with an electric fence put up in a farm area. The fence was reportedly put up by a farmer to tackle the menace of wild boars. CM MK Stalin ordered an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh to each of the three families.

393.title: UN accuses Taliban of extrajudicial killings & torture since takeover
393.article_body: The UN in a report on Wednesday accused the Taliban of extrajudicial killings, torture, arbitrary arrests and inhumane punishments since their takeover last year. The violations were targeted at a number of groups, including former government officials, human rights defenders and journalists, the report said. However, a spokesman for the Taliban government rejected the report's findings.

394.title: Italian PM Draghi to stay in office if allies recommit to unity
394.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Wednesday said he would rescind his resignation offer if his coalition partners recommit to unity. Last week, Draghi offered to resign after senators of ally 5-Star Movement boycotted a confidence vote. In recent days, citizens from all corners have urged Draghi to stay in office as Italy battles soaring inflation.

395.title: Heatwaves to become more frequent, will continue till 2060s: UN
395.article_body: Amid heatwaves in Europe, UN said that heatwaves will become more frequent and are likely to continue until 2060s irrespective of climate mitigation efforts. "Emissions are still growing...especially in...big Asian countries which are...largest emitters," UN's World Meteorological Organization chief said. Notably, UK reported its hottest day on July 19 as temperatures crossed 40°C for first time.

396.title: Sri Lanka seeks UK intelligence help in Easter Sunday attack probe
396.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was elected Sri Lanka's President on Wednesday, has sought the assistance of the British intelligence services to complete the probe of the Easter Sunday suicide attacks in 2019. Wickremesinghe said the absence of proper investigation of the attacks meant the issue was not yet resolved. The suicide attacks had killed nearly 270 people in the island nation.

397.title: MVA govt didn't implement schemes for minorities properly: Maha SP
397.article_body: The Maharashtra unit of Samajwadi Party on Wednesday criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government and said it failed to implement important schemes of the minority ministry properly. "We've evaluated the performance of...schemes...being run by the state Minority Department," SP MLA Rais Shaikh said. "In nearly 19 of them, the utilisation of funds is less than 50%," he added.

398.title: RPF seized drugs worth ₹40.58 cr from 2019 to 2021; arrested 1,108: Govt
398.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) recovered narcotics worth ₹40.58 crore in the last three years, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. In a written reply to a question in Lok Sabha, he said between 2019 and 2021, the RPF registered 1,262 cases related to narcotics and arrested 1,108 people. The seized narcotics were handed over to the agencies empowered to investigate.

399.title: Man, his 66-yr-old grandmother stabbed in Delhi after row with 2 men
399.article_body: A 22-year-old man and his 66-year-old grandmother were allegedly stabbed in South Delhi's Mehrauli. The youth said two men were shouting and using abusive language near his house on Tuesday, following which his grandmother asked them to leave the place. Thereafter, a scuffle took place between them and the men later came with their associates to attack them, he added.

400.title: Turkish airstrikes kill 8 in Iraq, over 20 injured
400.article_body: Airstrikes by Turkey killed eight tourists and wounded over a dozen people in northern Iraq on Wednesday, Iraqi Kurdish officials said. The semi-autonomous Kurdish-run district of Zakho was targeted in the attack. The Kurdistan Worker's Party has led insurgency in southeast Turkey since 1984 and is listed as a terrorist organisation by Turkey, the United States and the European Union.

401.title: Cong not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President: K'taka CM
401.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress and said the party is not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President. "Shivakumar has been nursing the dream of becoming the CM...We've been watching what is happening in Congress," Bommai said. This comes after DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said Congress coming to power was more important than him becoming the CM.
